Package ajbc.doodle.calendar.controllers

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
ajbc.doodle.calendar.controllers.UserController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/users") public class UserController extends Object
Restful api service that receives http requests about Users of the calendar.
Author:
Anna Aba

  • Method Details

    • getAllUsers

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllUsers(@RequestParam(required=false) String start, @RequestParam(required=false) String end)
      Returns all users (not active also) from the database. Two optional params - start and end date-time of event. If both parameters exist - then the function returns all users with event in this range.
      Parameters:
      start - date-time of event.
      end - date-time of event.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with list of users.

    • getUserByIdOrEmail

      @GetMapping("/{idOrEmail}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getUserByIdOrEmail(@PathVariable String idOrEmail)
      Gets an unique id or email, and returns the user with it.
      Parameters:
      idOrEmail - String that represents an id of user or an email.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with the user.

    • getUsersByEventId

      @GetMapping("/event/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getUsersByEventId(@PathVariable("id") int eventId)
      Returns all the users that have this event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the id of the event.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with list of users.

    • addUsers

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addUsers(@RequestBody List<ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.User> users)
      Adds list of new users with unique email to the database.
      Parameters:
      users - list of new users.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with the list of new users.

    • updateUsers

      @PutMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateUsers(@RequestBody List<ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.User> users)
      Updates list of existed users in the database.
      Parameters:
      users - list of users to update.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with the list of updated users.

    • softDeleteUser

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> softDeleteUser(@PathVariable int id)
      Deletes user by switching the isActive flag to false.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the user to delete.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with the deleted user.

    • hardDeleteUser

      @DeleteMapping("{id}/delete") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> hardDeleteUser(@PathVariable int id)
      Deletes the user completely from the database, and his notifications also.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the user to delete.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with the deleted user.
